page.title: 12CHERINGTON-TRACKS & PATHS
page.content: The area is covered by various Public Rights of Way. Footpaths account for the majority, there being 8.8 km. all told. Rough track occupies 1.4 km. and Bridlepaths approximately 1 km. These figures reflect a pattern found throughout the County, footpaths being the dominant method for crossing the open countryside. In the north of the area lies the airfield Aston Down, greatly extended during World War 2. This necessitated the diversion of lanes and footpaths, whose original courses can still be traced on the Ordnance Survey maps. The condition of footpaths varies from very good to overgrown.
